intro: Taeniophyllum bakhuizenii, commonly known as the Cape mountain daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and linear. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native range.
